Prom
  • preprocess module
  • View page source

preprocess module

preprocess.copy_files_with_prefix(source_folder, destination_folder, prefix)[source]

Copies files containing a specific prefix within their content from the source folder to the destination folder.

Parameters:

  • source_folder (str) – The path to the source folder containing files.

  • destination_folder (str) – The path to the destination folder where files will be copied.

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to search for within file contents.

Return type:

None

preprocess.findAllFile(dir)[source]

Recursively finds all files in a given directory.

Parameters:

dir (str) – The directory path to search for files.

Yields:

tuple – A tuple containing the root directory and the file name for each file found.

preprocess.pre(dataset='../../../benchmark/Bug', random_seed=1234, num_folders=8)[source]

Preprocesses files from the given dataset by selecting a sample of text files from each folder, shuffling, and splitting them into training, validation, and testing sets.

Parameters:

  • dataset (str, optional) – Path to the dataset directory, by default “../../../benchmark/Bug”.

  • random_seed (int, optional) – Seed for randomization, by default 1234.

  • num_folders (int, optional) – Number of folders to sample from within the dataset, by default 8.

Return type:

None

preprocess.process_folder(folder_path, count_dict)[source]

Counts occurrences of each CWE prefix in .txt files within a folder and its subfolders, storing counts in the provided dictionary.

Parameters:

  • folder_path (str) – The path to the folder containing the text files.

  • count_dict (dict) – Dictionary to store the count of each CWE prefix.

Return type:

None
